explains: n. 弹劾；控告；怀疑；指摘

sentences.en: When his boss asked if he was late for work, he admitted the soft impeachment .
sentences.cn: 当他的老板问他是否迟到时，他承认他是迟到了。

sentences.en: Rod Blagojevich, former Illinois governor, at his impeachment trial in Illinois.
sentences.cn: 伊利诺伊州前州长罗德·布拉戈耶维奇在对他的弹劾案裁决时说。

sentences.en: And we need consummate the impeachment rules further to enhance the maneuverability in practice.
sentences.cn: 同时，法律也应进一步完善质证所需的规则，以增加质证的可操作性。
